crypto.name: Cursed Decryption
crypto.desc: My decryption function is cursed, and now I've lost my flag forever...

crypto.name: Fence Building
crypto.desc:
I've recently got into woodworking and have build a beautiful fence just like this one.

Now I'm working on a flag, but it turns out all garbled for some reason...

T0n40g5BG03cmk0D1hr}T{dFe_3g_3buL_5_n0

crypto.name: Kung Fu Cipher
crypto.desc: Stop trying to decrypt the flag and decrypt the flag!

crypto.name: Pianists Cipher
crypto.desc:
He says, "Son, can you play me a memory?
I'm not really sure how it goes
But it's sad and I'd brag how I found a gilmpse of a flag
When I wore a younger man's clothes"

crypto.name: School Essay
crypto.desc: I had to write an essay for school describing my favorite classmate. I wonder if my classmates will be able to figure out who I'm describing...

crypto.name: University Paper
crypto.desc: I had to write a scientific paper for one of my university courses describing my scientific role model. I wonder if my professors will be able to figure out who I'm describing...

crypto.name: Wikipedia Signatures
crypto.desc:
https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Digital_signature&oldid=1113936031

Alice signs a message—"Hello Bob!"—by appending to the original message a version encrypted with her private key. Bob receives both the message and signature. He uses Alice's public key to verify the authenticity of the message, i.e. that the encrypted copy, decrypted using the public key, exactly matches the original message.

misc.name: Locking Mechanism
misc.desc: Could you unlock the flag secured with the thread lock mechanism?

misc.name: Unfair Camera Wire
misc.desc: Honey, have you seen my keys?

misc.name: Your papers please
misc.desc: Verifiable credentials are the future of digital identity! Our software might not be ready for the future though...

pwn.name: A Day at the Races
pwn.desc: May the fastest code win! Just make sure you get a green light from the security team before racing.

pwn.name: Diamonds and Rust
pwn.desc:
No descripton — just enjoy the music.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IrVD0bP_ybg

pwn.name: Enough with the averages
pwn.desc: Statistics can say anything you want them to ... perhaps even the flag.

pwn.name: Heap Peek and Poke
pwn.desc: Last year's solutions were unintended, let's try it again.

pwn.name: Squeezing Tightly On Arm
pwn.desc: Only the source can help you to escape from Python.

rev.name: Flagcheck
rev.desc: This one is simple — you provide the flag, and the binary tells you if its correct.

rev.name: Floo Powder
rev.desc:
When travelling by Floo powder it is important that you speak clearly, take care to get out at the right grate, keep your elbows tucked in, shut your eyes, don’t fidget and don’t panic.

Otherwise, you might end up in the wrong place without any flags.

rev.name: Safe Rust
rev.desc: A few years back, a colleague of ours joined the company and uploaded some secure Rust code to the repository. Unfortunately, the repository has since been deleted, leaving us with only the executable file. The issue we're facing now is that the binary isn't functioning properly. Could you assist us in extracting the flag from the executable?

rev.name: Vault
rev.desc: We are proud to present our brand-new serverlessTM️, passwordlessTM️ Vault. Unlock the Vault to get your flag.

web.name: Mexico City Tour
web.desc: Our colleague is currently on vacation in Mexico City and is using a local website to calculate distances between subway stations. We have information that the database contains a city FLAG. Can you uncover the secret? Perhaps we can identify a vulnerability and secure a free vacation for our colleague.

web.name: Rnd For Data Science
web.desc: We've come across a simple tool for generating random matrices. As many people are using this service, we'd like to leverage your expertise to determine if the site is safe.
